title: 109_s2816
content: The "Biofuels Security Tax Act of 2006" may be cited as the short title. It includes a tax credit for flexible fuel vehicles. The "Biofuels Security Tax Act of 2006" includes a tax credit for flexible fuel vehicles that can operate on gasoline and 85% ethanol fuel. The "Biofuels Security Tax Act of 2006" offers a tax credit for flexible fuel vehicles that run on a blend of 85% ethanol fuel (E-85) and gasoline, meeting specific criteria for fuel economy and original use by the taxpayer. The amendments made by the "Biofuels Security Tax Act of 2006" apply to new qualified alternative fuel vehicles placed in service after the enactment date of the Act. SEC. 3. Modification of alternative fuel refueling property credit. The alternative fuel refueling property credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is modified by extending the timeline to 2016 and increasing the rate from 30% to 50%. Additionally, a higher rate of 75% applies to taxpayers with not more than 5 qualified alternative fuel vehicle refueling properties placed in service in the taxable year. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the alternative fuel refueling property credit rate to 50% and extend the timeline to 2016. A higher rate of 75% applies to taxpayers with not more than 5 qualified alternative fuel vehicle refueling properties. Major oil companies are not eligible for this credit. The term 'major oil company' is defined as a person with at least 4,500 retail station outlets. The amendments apply to property placed in service after the enactment of the Act.
